Board & Meetings Visit Central Florida’s Tourist Development Council’s primary objective is to increase overnight stays in Polk County accommodations and enhance the county’s economic climate. About Where Is Polk County Staff Tourist Development Council Sports & Special Events Committee Arts, Culture and Heritage Committee Marketing Committee CATS Tourism Ambassador Program Support for Tourism Partners Partner Newsletter Sign Up Contact Us Privacy & Accessibility Promotional Disclaimers Google My Business Workshops Tourist Development Council (TDC) Board members must derive a portion of their income, or be employed in a business that deals directly with tourists, has an extensive knowledge of or background in the marketing and/or sales of tourism goods or services. Examples of such businesses would include attractions, restaurants, museums, hospitality education and other businesses, which cater to tourists. Tourist Development Council Members Martha Santiago, Committee Chair and County Commissioner Brad Dantzler, Municipality Chad McLeod, Municipality Dan Talbot, Polk County School Board Dexter Pagara, Accommodations Michael Phillips, Accommodations Randy Knapp, Camp Margaritaville RV Resort Zach Burek, Lakeland Flying Tigers TDC Meeting Dates Meetings are generally held on the 4th Thursday, every other month at 9:00 a.m. unless otherwise noted in red, at 2701 Lake Myrtle Park Rd., Auburndale, FL February 27, 2025 April 24, 2025 May 29, 2025 TDC Board Retreat August 28, 2025 October 23, 2025 December 11, 2025 Planning a Vacation in Florida? Planning a Vacation in Florida? Events Whether it’s an electrifying live concert or a breathtaking walk through a scenic garden, a variety of sensational events are happening year-round in Central Florida. Browse all of our amazing events below and make plans for a year filled with fun. Love the arts? Explore Lakeland’s thriving arts scene by visiting LKLDArts.org . A Central Florida vacation gives visitors a chance to unpack once and see it all in Florida’s Sweetest Spot. Here you’ll find things to do in Central Florida, including major theme parks, citrus grove and farm tours, historic landmarks, and ways to cruise Winter Haven’s Chain of Lakes. Central Florida features a variety of unique towns and cities for you to explore, each with their own collection of adventures to choose from. Exhilarating attractions, delicious restaurants and breathtaking outdoor experiences are just the start of the excitement that awaits you in Florida’s Sweetest Spot. Visit Central Florida to experience family-friendly attractions such as LEGOLAND® Florida Resort, Bok Tower Gardens, Safari Wilderness, pick oranges, peaches and blueberries, see performances at our award winning theatres, or enjoy our wonderful weather while hiking, cycling or during an airboat ride. Whether you are visiting Central Florida’s Polk County or have lived here for more than a decade, discover the more than 50 places and activities that we think everyone should experience in Central Florida! Don’t forget to book a stay . Stay connected through Facebook for all of our events Plan A Trip TOP EVENTS

Check out the local events you can enjoy while in town for your next sporting event.

Planning a Vacation in Florida? Visit Central Florida Staff A Central Florida vacation gives visitors a chance to unpack once and see it all in Florida’s Sweetest Spot. Here you’ll find things to do in Central Florida, including major theme parks, citrus grove and farm tours, historic landmarks, and ways to cruise Winter Haven’s Chain of Lakes. Things to Do in Central Florida’s Sweetest Spot Located between Orlando and Tampa, Winter Haven is home to LEGOLAND Florida Resort. In addition, you may enjoy attractions like Bok Tower Gardens and the cageless Safari Wilderness. Lakeland offers big city shopping and dining options, plus the world’s largest one-site collection of Frank Lloyd Wright architecture on the campus of Florida Southern College. Other things to do include visiting the best of natural Florida at Circle B Bar Reserve, known one of the best places to see alligators. About Polk County Plan A Trip About Where Is Polk County Staff Tourist Development Council Sports & Special Events Committee Arts, Culture and Heritage Committee Marketing Committee CATS Tourism Ambassador Program Support for Tourism Partners Partner Newsletter Sign Up Contact Us Privacy & Accessibility Promotional Disclaimers Google My Business Workshops Central Florida’s Polk County is conveniently located between Orlando and Tampa, and an easy drive to Central Florida attractions and the Gulf and Atlantic beaches. Polk County offers something for everyone, including Florida’s newest attractions, LEGOLAND Florida Resort , the world’s first Peppa Pig Theme Park Florida and Safari Wilderness Ranch ; and some of Florida’s most historic; including Bok Tower Gardens , Westgate River Ranch Resort (the Southeast’s largest dude ranch), and Frank Lloyd Wright’s 13 structures at Florida Southern College . With 554 fresh water lakes, the area offers great fishing, adventurous airboat eco tours and exciting water sports. Wonderful parks, preserves and trails captivate visitors with Polk County’s natural beauty. Who We Are and What We Do Polk County Tourism and Sports Marketing (PCTSM) – known outside the county as Visit Central Florida – is a division of Polk County Government. As Polk County’s official tourism and sports marketing organization, PCTSM promotes Polk County as a tourist destination to increase visitation to Polk County and to generate revenue from the tourist development tax. Tourism is the state’s number one industry, and one of Polk County’s top three industries. The revenue it generates helps to fund the sales and marketing operations of PCTSM as well as the development, and improvement, of infrastructure used to attract tourists. Tourism strengthens Polk County’s economy by creating jobs, new revenue and a better quality of life. Visit Central Florida Sports It is the mission of Visit Central Florida Sports to promote tourism and economic development through sports. Visit Central Florida Sports focuses on developing new events, recruiting sports activities, assisting existing sports events and marketing recreation and leisure activities. VCF Sports is the only organization in the state to earn both the Sports Organization of the Year award from the Governor’s Council on Physical Fitness and the Florida Sports Foundation’s Sports Commission of the Year Award. VCF Sports has also been recognized as the Sports Organization of the Year by both the Independent Softball Association and Youth Basketball of America. Committee & Meetings Tourist Development Council (TDC) Sports & Special Events Committee meets six times per year, or as needed, to advise and assist staff with marketing, recruiting and hosting sports and special events. The committee will make recommendations as to the sponsorship of special events. About Where Is Polk County Staff Tourist Development Council Sports & Special Events Committee Arts, Culture and Heritage Committee Marketing Committee CATS Tourism Ambassador Program Support for Tourism Partners Partner Newsletter Sign Up Contact Us Privacy & Accessibility Promotional Disclaimers Google My Business Workshops Tourist Development Council (TDC) Sports & Special Events Committee meets six times per year, or as needed, to advise and assist staff with marketing, recruiting and hosting sports and special events. The committee will make recommendations as to the sponsorship of special events. Sports & Special Events Committee Members Dan Talbot – Committee Chair, Polk County Public Schools Bing Tyus, Polk County Diamond Club Bob Donahay, City of Lakeland Cindy Collins, RP Funding Center Cody McGhee, City of Auburndale Dave Dershimer, Cypress Gardens Water Ski Team Drew Howard, Florida Southern College Drew Watson, Southeastern University Gene Engle, Gene Engle REALTOR Jason Hargrove, City of Bartow Joel Dragan, Florida Youth Soccer Association Julie Adams, City of Winter Haven Dr. Katherine Loh, Pan American Lacrosse Association and Florida Southern College Kevin Michael, USA Water Ski & Wake Sports Terrell Griffin, Haines City Parks & Recreation SSE Meeting Dates Meetings are generally held on the 3rd Thursday, every other month at 9:00 a.m. unless otherwise noted and travel to various locations around the county. Submit Event Info If you are hosting an event in Polk County that would be of interest to people visiting Central Florida, we would like to publish the event on our calendar. Submit your event details below! Plan A Trip Please keep in mind the event MUST be occurring in Polk County and should be of interest to Polk County visitors. Events will be reviewed for approval by the Visit Central Florida staff. Staff will be notified of the submission and your event will appear in the online calendar once approved. Visit Central Florida reserves the right to edit or deny all submissions. Notice: JavaScript is required for this content.
